1. Town Council

Town Council
============

![Group photo of Town Council](https://www.flowermound.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=41756)

*From left to right: Ann Martin, Brian Taylor,  Adam Schiestel, Cheryl Moore, Chris Drew, and Janvier Werner.*

* First and third Monday of the month, with work sessions scheduled, as needed, on the third Thursday of the month.

The following Town Council voting record for regular items only is effective November 16, 2020, and will be periodically updated by the Town Secretary's Office. There is a worksheet within the Excel file for each elected official.

| **Position** | **Link to Details** | **Email** | **Elected** | **Term Expires** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mayor | [Cheryl Moore](https://www.flowermound.gov/directory.aspx?EID=2) | [c](mailto:cheryl.moore@flowermound.gov) [heryl.moore@flowermound.gov](mailto:cheryl.moore@flowermound.gov) | 2024 | 2027 |
| Place 1 | [Adam Schiestel](https://www.flowermound.gov/directory.aspx?EID=12) Deputy Mayor Pro Tem | [adam.schiestel@flowermound.gov](mailto:adam.schiestel@flowermound.gov) | 2021 *(Appointed), 2022; 2025* | 2028 (termed out) |
| Place 2 | [Chris Drew](https://www.flowermound.gov/directory.aspx?EID=7) | [chris.drew@flowermound.gov](mailto:chris.drew@flowermound.gov) | 2023 | 2026 |
| Place 3 | [Brian Taylor](https://www.flowermound.gov/directory.aspx?EID=8) | [brian.taylor@flowermound.gov](mailto:brian.taylor@flowermound.gov) | 2022; 2025 | 2028 (termed out) |
| Place 4 | [Janvier Werner](https://www.flowermound.gov/directory.aspx?EID=13) | j [anvier.werner@flowermound.gov](mailto:Janvier.Werner@flowermound.gov) | 2024 | 2027 |
| Place 5 | [Ann Martin](https://www.flowermound.gov/directory.aspx?EID=15)  Mayor Pro Tem | [ann.martin@flowermound.gov](mailto:ann.martin@flowermound.gov) | 2020; 2023 | 2026 (termed out) |

Contact Us
----------

[Email](mailto:towncouncil@flowermound.gov)
the Mayor and Town Council simultaneously. Please note, all correspondence received is considered a public record and therefore may be subject to disclosure under the
Texas Public Information Act
.

Flower Mound Town Council Members are elected “at-large”  for a 3-year term with term limits of no more than two full consecutive terms and the allowance of two additional terms if a councilmember becomes mayor.

All powers of the Town, and the determination of all matters of policy, are vested in the Town Council. The powers of the council include, but are not limited to, adoption of the annual
Town budget
, appointment of a
Town Manager
,
Town Secretary
,
Town Attorney
, and
Municipal Judge
, and provide vision and direction for all Town policies and initiatives.
